hints.label: def-two-time-evolutions
hints.title: Two Time Evolutions in Open Quantum Systems
hints.content:
76: :label: def-two-time-evolutions
77: 
78: Our framework has **two distinct concepts of time**:
79: 
80: 1.  **System Evolution (Lindbladian)**: The physical, irreversible evolution of the open system's density matrix:
81: 
82: $$
83: \rho(t) = e^{t\mathcal{L}}(\rho_0) \quad \text{where } \mathcal{L}(\rho) = -i[H,\rho] + \mathcal{L}_{\text{diss}}[\rho]
84: $$
85: 
86: This is a **completely positive trace-preserving (CPTP)** map, NOT an automorphism. It describes how the system approaches thermal equilibrium.
87: 
88: 2.  **Equilibrium Dynamics (Hamiltonian Automorphism)**: The reversible, unitary time translation symmetry of observables *at equilibrium*:
89: 
90: $$
91: \alpha_t(A) = e^{iHt} A e^{-iHt}
92: $$
93:
hints.raw_directive:
73: A crucial distinction must be made clear:
74: 
75: :::{prf:definition} Two Time Evolutions in Open Quantum Systems
76: :label: def-two-time-evolutions
77: 
78: Our framework has **two distinct concepts of time**:
79: 
80: 1.  **System Evolution (Lindbladian)**: The physical, irreversible evolution of the open system's density matrix:
81: 
82: $$
83: \rho(t) = e^{t\mathcal{L}}(\rho_0) \quad \text{where } \mathcal{L}(\rho) = -i[H,\rho] + \mathcal{L}_{\text{diss}}[\rho]
84: $$
85: 
86: This is a **completely positive trace-preserving (CPTP)** map, NOT an automorphism. It describes how the system approaches thermal equilibrium.
87: 
88: 2.  **Equilibrium Dynamics (Hamiltonian Automorphism)**: The reversible, unitary time translation symmetry of observables *at equilibrium*:
89: 
90: $$
91: \alpha_t(A) = e^{iHt} A e^{-iHt}
92: $$
93: 
94: This **is** an automorphism group $\{\alpha_t\}_{t \in \mathbb{R}}$. It uses only the Hamiltonian $H$ from the unitary part of the Lindbladian. The dissipator $\mathcal{L}_{\text{diss}}$ does **not** affect $\alpha_t$.

hints.label: def-kms-state
hints.title: KMS State at Temperature $T$
hints.content:
110: :label: def-kms-state
111: 
112: Let $\mathcal{A}$ be a C*-algebra of observables and $\alpha_t: \mathcal{A} \to \mathcal{A}$ a one-parameter automorphism group. A state $\omega: \mathcal{A} \to \mathbb{C}$ is a **KMS state at inverse temperature $\beta = 1/T$** if:
113: 
114: For all $A, B \in \mathcal{A}$, the function $F_{A,B}(t) = \omega(A \alpha_t(B))$ extends to an analytic function in the complex strip $S_\beta = \{z \in \mathbb{C} \mid 0 < \text{Im}(z) < \beta\}$, and satisfies the boundary condition:
115: 
116: $$
117: \omega(A \alpha_t(B)) = \omega(\alpha_{t+i\beta}(B) A) \quad \forall t \in \mathbb{R}
hints.raw_directive:
107: The central goal is to prove that our quasi-stationary distribution $\rho_{\text{QSD}}$ is a **Kubo-Martin-Schwinger (KMS) state** at temperature $T$.
108: 
109: :::{prf:definition} KMS State at Temperature $T$
110: :label: def-kms-state
111: 
112: Let $\mathcal{A}$ be a C*-algebra of observables and $\alpha_t: \mathcal{A} \to \mathcal{A}$ a one-parameter automorphism group. A state $\omega: \mathcal{A} \to \mathbb{C}$ is a **KMS state at inverse temperature $\beta = 1/T$** if:
113: 
114: For all $A, B \in \mathcal{A}$, the function $F_{A,B}(t) = \omega(A \alpha_t(B))$ extends to an analytic function in the complex strip $S_\beta = \{z \in \mathbb{C} \mid 0 < \text{Im}(z) < \beta\}$, and satisfies the boundary condition:
115: 
116: $$
117: \omega(A \alpha_t(B)) = \omega(\alpha_{t+i\beta}(B) A) \quad \forall t \in \mathbb{R}
118: $$

hints.label: thm-kms-simplified
hints.title: Simplified KMS Condition for Density Matrices
hints.content:
125: :label: thm-kms-simplified
126: 
127: For a density matrix $\rho$ and automorphism $\alpha_t(A) = e^{iHt} A e^{-iHt}$, the KMS condition at inverse temperature $\beta$ is equivalent to:
128: 
129: $$
130: \boxed{ \text{Tr}(\rho A B) = \text{Tr}(\rho B e^{-\beta H} A e^{\beta H}) \quad \forall A, B \in \mathcal{A} }
131: $$
132: 
133: This holds if and only if $\rho$ is the **Gibbs state**:
134: 
135: $$
136: \rho = \frac{e^{-\beta H}}{\text{Tr}(e^{-\beta H})} =: \rho_{\text{Gibbs}}(\beta)
hints.raw_directive:
122: For our density matrix $\rho_{\text{QSD}}$, the state is $\omega_\beta(A) = \text{Tr}(\rho_{\text{QSD}} A)$. The automorphism group is $\alpha_t(A) = e^{iHt} A e^{-iHt}$.
123: 
124: :::{prf:theorem} Simplified KMS Condition for Density Matrices
125: :label: thm-kms-simplified
126: 
127: For a density matrix $\rho$ and automorphism $\alpha_t(A) = e^{iHt} A e^{-iHt}$, the KMS condition at inverse temperature $\beta$ is equivalent to:
128: 
129: $$
130: \boxed{ \text{Tr}(\rho A B) = \text{Tr}(\rho B e^{-\beta H} A e^{\beta H}) \quad \forall A, B \in \mathcal{A} }
131: $$
132: 
133: This holds if and only if $\rho$ is the **Gibbs state**:
134: 
135: $$
136: \rho = \frac{e^{-\beta H}}{\text{Tr}(e^{-\beta H})} =: \rho_{\text{Gibbs}}(\beta)
137: $$

hints.label: def-fractal-set-regions
hints.title: Spacetime Regions on the Fractal Set
hints.content:
170: :label: def-fractal-set-regions
171: 
172: Our base spacetime is the **Fractal Set** $\mathcal{F} = \{(x_i, t_i)\}_{i=1}^N$, a discrete causal set. A **spacetime region** is simply a subset:
173: 
174: $$
175: O \subseteq \mathcal{F}
176: $$
177: 
178: **Spacelike separation**: Two points $i, j \in \mathcal{F}$ are **spacelike separated** if neither $i \prec j$ nor $j \prec i$ in the causal order (see {doc}`13_fractal_set_new/07_discrete_symmetries_gauge.md`).
hints.raw_directive:
167: The Haag-Kastler axioms are formulated in terms of a **net of local algebras** $\{\mathcal{A}(O)\}$ assigned to spacetime regions $O$.
168:

hints.label: def-local-algebras-fractal-set
hints.title: Local Algebras from Fock Space Operators
hints.content:
184: :label: def-local-algebras-fractal-set
185: 
186: Recall from §12 the corrected Fock space construction with creation/annihilation operators $\psi^\dagger(x,v), \psi(x,v)$ satisfying canonical commutation relations:
187: 
188: $$
189: [\psi(x,v), \psi^\dagger(x',v')] = \delta(x-x') \delta(v-v')
190: $$
191: 
192: For a discrete causal set, we discretize the labels. For each point $i \in \mathcal{F}$, define operators:
193: 
194: $$
195: a_i^\dagger := \psi^\dagger(x_i, v_i), \quad a_i := \psi(x_i, v_i)
196: $$
197: 
198: The **local algebra** for region $O \subseteq \mathcal{F}$ is the **von Neumann algebra** generated by all operators associated with points in $O$:
199: 
200: $$
201: \mathcal{A}(O) := \{ a_i, a_i^\dagger \mid i \in O \}''
202: $$

hints.content:
239: :label: axiom-hk-covariance
240:

242: 
243: $$
244: \mathcal{A}(gO) = U_g \mathcal{A}(O) U_g^\dagger

hints.title: HK5: Time-Slice Axiom
hints.content:
256: :label: axiom-hk-time-slice
257: 
258: Let $S \subseteq \mathcal{F}$ be a **Cauchy surface** (a subset intersecting every inextendible causal curve exactly once). Then:
259: 
260: $$
261: \mathcal{A}(S) = \mathcal{A}(\mathcal{F})
262: $$
